articles.title: Kim Jong Il to visit Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to visit Russia 
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, will soon pay an official visit to the russian federation at the invitation of President V.V. Putin.

Officials of Lao embassy help Korean farmers
articles.content:
Officials of Lao embassy help Korean farmers 
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Lao charge d'affaires a.i. Chanpheng Inthavanh and embassy officials visited the Korea-Laos Friendship Taewon Co-op Farm in Sadong district, Pyongyang, yesterday and helped farmers in farming.
 During a break they sang songs and danced with farmers, deepening the feelings of friendship.    
 They handed over aid materials to the farm.

Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the committee on family and women under the government of the Republic of Tajikistan.
 The gift was conveyed to vice-president Yang Hyong Sop of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly by Latofat Shokhmurodovna Nasridinova, head of the committee who is leading its delegation on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Message of sympathy to Indian prime minister
articles.content:
Message of sympathy to Indian prime minister 
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of sympathy to Indian prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee.
 Upon hearing the news that torrential rain recently hit coastal areas in Orissa state in India causing huge human and material losses, he in the message expressed deep sympathy to him, and through him, to the people in the afflicted areas.    
 The message expressed the belief that the Indian government and people would recover from the flood damage and bring the living of the people in those areas to normal as soon as possible.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Il from military attaches corps
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Il from military attaches corps 
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps in Korea presented a congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army, on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
 The letter was handed to minister of the people's armed forces Kim Il Chol today by military attache of the Chinese embassy Yan Jiangfeng, doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Greetings to Peruvian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Peruvian president
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly yesterday sent a message of greetings to Alejandro Toledo Manrique, President of Peru, on the occasion of the independence day, the national holiday of the Peruvian people.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the President, government and people of Peru on the independence day.    
 It expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to develop on good terms and sincerely wished the president and people of Peru success in their efforts for the prosperity of the country.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from IUA president
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from IUA President
    Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the president of the international union of architects.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by president Vassilis Sqoutas on a visit to the DPRK.
